align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1385048"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1385048#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1375093" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1375093" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Advaitaforever"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224809"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1224809.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Advaitaforever" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Houbigant/Essence-Rare-51691.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51691.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Essence Rare"title="Essence Rare"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1375093ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1375093" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224809">Advaitaforever</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-13">07/13/21 04:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very distinguished and transportive to a bygone era, a green sandalwood fragrance, something Ive never experienced before. The sandalwood is refreshingly authentic but Im not particularly excited about the bitter, almost savoury vetiver that accompanies it. I love the incense that blends beautifully with the sandalwood and adds an opaque, smoky texture. This reminds me of Basil from the Portrait of Dorian Gray, a mature, cultured and artistic man who buries himself in books and museums. He isnt flamboyant and doesnt try to attract attention but hes a very curious character. He wears corduroy trousers and earthy colours.  Its very unisex but it isnt pretty, its more intellectual. This is more punchy in performance compared to some of the lighter offerings from the house.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1375093"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1375093#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1349116" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1349116" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="J350"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201660"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="J350" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1349116ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1349116" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201660">J350</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-25">05/25/21 11:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells pleasant and nice. I like the jasmine, incense and sandalwood notes settling down to a woody-powdery and floral scent. The bergamot almost disappears straight after. I probably own several fragrances that smells similar. I would love to own one but for 204 for 75mls is way too overpriced. <br />
<br />
I dont whether its the notes, longevity and sillage that makes me want to own one or the fact that this fragrance comes from Penhaligons which is a brand that I am becoming addicted and drawn to! <br />
<br />
Overall rating: 6/10 (lost several points mainly due to the price)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1349116"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1349116#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1346547" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1346547" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Yjinn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1277409"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Yjinn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Beach-Hut-Man-46336.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46336.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Beach Hut Man"title="Beach Hut Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1346547ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1346547" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1277409">Yjinn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-20">05/20/21 11:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells pleasant and nice, in a very clich way. W. Penhaligon lacks character and depth up to the end, with the powdery sandalwood skin scent we've smelled from countless other fragrances before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1346547"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1346547#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1337213" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1337213" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mohsen95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mohsen95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1337213ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1337213" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817">mohsen95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-04">05/04/21 07:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>3/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1337213"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1337213#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1334909" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1334909" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1334909ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1334909" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-30">04/30/21 05:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Aspects of this are good. <br />
The opening conveys the pleasant citrus fruits, its got sharp citrus, ya limes, yer bergamots, but quite muted allowing for a nice translucent veil you can see the rest of the fragrance through, as it were. I get a slight facet of like grapes or pear or something, but immediately levied against dry GnT Sparkle, which continues the dehydrated theme into vetiver territory. Then it goes off the reservation for me, souring down on skin to a dry boring, papery, base which to me is predominantly Iso E Super or Timbersilk. Sure Ill give you that theres ambroxan and sandalwood molecules too if you insist but it mainly smells of arid, bready,  wood, with only shades of the top and heart left after a relatively short period.<br />
Ive kinda been tempted by Morillas own line because from memory and although in his style I found some of them to be just fantastic. However, this is always my worry that they wont deliver on the full perfume experience and leave me wanting, like this one does. <br />
Sorry Albert lad!<br />
I mean its okay, but its top loaded to make you think it might be good and justify buying, but Id be disappointed if I bought that fancy bottle and this was lurking in the drydown.<br />
<br />
UPDATE: okay so I was a little hasty and I found it odd that it went so dry, paper woody and boring, now the musks, woody amber, Ambroxan and stuff is chiming and it smells like a high end designer fragrance. Which is what it is. I actually had a shower and washed it off but the remnant is really nice, uninspired but nice and I cant deny I do like commercial accords like this, its a weakness of mine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1334909"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1334909#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1318314" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1318314" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PerfumePizza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290030"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1290030.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PerfumePizza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1318314ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1318314" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290030">PerfumePizza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-02">04/02/21 13:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the most impressive looking perfumes! And I've added another one to my collection. The Inimitable William Penhaligon from the Portraits Collection! Just look at the elegant bottle with cap! I was highly anticipating this one, since the perfumes that made this one is the same as The Tragedy of Lord George.... Yes you've guessed it Alberto Morillas! Since I was a huge fan of Lord George, and ofcourse many other perfumes by the masterperfumer, I really looked forward to this one. Lets just say it from the start, like all perfumes from the Portraits Collection, the perfume is not a beastmode, its not loud and it does not shout! All the perfumes are elegant, like the British upperclass. Ofcourse also with all the drama and scandals... Lets not get into that right now. The Inimitable William Penhaligon starts of as a fresh fougere, with notes of bergamot and jasmine in the top. The middle consist of cedar, vetiver and incense. And especially the vetiver gets more dominant with the minute! I love vetiver fragrances, so this is an absolutely win for me. The vetiver is green and aromatic. Soon the vetiver looses the fresh nuances and lands on this creamy sandalwood, while staying dominant with the vetiver. The ambroxan from the base give the fougere touch (ofcourse in combination with the vetiver)! And if someone knows how to handle ambroxan, its Mr. Morillas! Of I want a doctor I would swear the man has ambroxan running through his veins. All with all, very elegant fresh creamy fougere fragrances!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1318314"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1318314#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1287949" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1287949" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Antoine Seraveu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1255220"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Antoine Seraveu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1287949ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1287949" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1255220">Antoine Seraveu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-06">02/06/21 05:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A sweet coconut-y sandalwood with a prominent green vetiver in the dry down. The bergamot makes the opening fresher. A comfortable projection and sillage.So lovely fragrance from Penhaligon's done in the European style (the most of Portraits collection are Eastern-centered). <br />
<br />
Reminds me of the new Caron Aimez Moi Comme Je Suis.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1287949"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1287949#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1276889" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1276889" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pbrooks95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275405"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1275405.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pbrooks95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1276889ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1276889" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275405">Pbrooks95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-16">01/16/21 07:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a perfume that I would not recommend blind buying as it smelled SO differently on my boyfriend to myself. Personally, I've never been a huge fan of Vetiver so was not expecting to like it but on my skin Vetiver is not the most prominent note. It's a great composition as I can smell every single note and it works really well. On my skin, I get a dose of citrus and floral on a bed of creamy sandalwood. Almost smells like the love child of Penhaligon's Heartless Helen and Monsieur Beauregard with a tiny bit of Vetiver and Ambroxan thrown in, making it an unoffensive unisex perfume. <br />
<br />
However, on my boyfriend's skin, the Incense and Vetiver definitely dominate! Its so much spicier and interesting so I would recommend purchasing a sample first to see how it sits on your skin. I would like to add that its longevity, projection and sillage are poor for me. The fragrance was barely a skin scent after an hour which is a shame as I have so many of their other perfumes. Still an overall pleasant scent but its not particularly mind-blowing or exciting. Would be great for a desk job perhaps. But for the price, is it worth it?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1276889"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1276889#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1276833" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1276833" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="toni.w"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/531361"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="toni.w" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Douze/Sans-Rival-Leo-83929.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83929.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sans Rival Leo"title="Sans Rival Leo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1276833ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1276833" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/531361">toni.w</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-16">01/16/21 05:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very realistic and mellow tincture of vetiver and sandalwood. Class in a bottle!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1276833"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1276833#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1427758" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1427758" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="martin_jsgn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399460"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1399460.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="martin_jsgn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1427758ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1427758" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399460">martin_jsgn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-13">10/13/21 22:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a handsome and dapper fragrance. I put this on if i want to feel calm and collected, a perfect image of a gentleman. The opening is incredibly inviting with a light creamy floral scents. No standout notes in the opening, everything is so well-blended. After a while it turns completely into a fabulously smooth and milky sandalwood - well done, stunning, elegant.<br />
<br />
Performance on the moderate side, and it gets volatile on me really, not sure why, maybe it's the weather, my body temp, or just my mood-induced chemicals. Sillage is "cozy" for like 3-4hrs, then it turns into a skin scent and stays there quite a while actually (till the ~8th hour).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1427758"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1427758#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1276889" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1276889" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pbrooks95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275405"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1275405.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pbrooks95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1276889ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1276889" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275405">Pbrooks95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-16">01/16/21 07:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a perfume that I would not recommend blind buying as it smelled SO differently on my boyfriend to myself. Personally, I've never been a huge fan of Vetiver so was not expecting to like it but on my skin Vetiver is not the most prominent note. It's a great composition as I can smell every single note and it works really well. On my skin, I get a dose of citrus and floral on a bed of creamy sandalwood. Almost smells like the love child of Penhaligon's Heartless Helen and Monsieur Beauregard with a tiny bit of Vetiver and Ambroxan thrown in, making it an unoffensive unisex perfume. <br />
<br />
However, on my boyfriend's skin, the Incense and Vetiver definitely dominate! Its so much spicier and interesting so I would recommend purchasing a sample first to see how it sits on your skin. I would like to add that its longevity, projection and sillage are poor for me. The fragrance was barely a skin scent after an hour which is a shame as I have so many of their other perfumes. Still an overall pleasant scent but its not particularly mind-blowing or exciting. Would be great for a desk job perhaps. But for the price, is it worth it?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1276889"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1276889#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2133528" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2133528" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SamuAoud"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2106884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2106884.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SamuAoud" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2133528ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2133528" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2106884">SamuAoud</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 04:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My Dearest William Penhaligon,<br />
<br />
As I sit here, enveloped in the captivating essence that is your namesake fragrance, I am compelled to express the depths of my adoration for you. From the very moment our paths intertwined, I knew there was something truly extraordinary about you, something that would linger in the air long after you departed.<br />
<br />
Oh, William Penhaligon, how do I begin to describe the symphony of sensations you evoke? Your top notes, like a joyous overture, dance upon my senses with the effervescent freshness of bergamot and juniper, igniting a spark of exhilaration within me. As I delve deeper, I am enraptured by the tender embrace of lavender and geranium, their floral melodies weaving a tapestry of romance around my very being.<br />
<br />
But it is your heart, dear William, that truly steals my breath away. Here, nestled amidst the fragrant petals, lies the soul-stirring warmth of cinnamon and cloves, a passionate embrace that speaks of timeless devotion. And oh, how my heart quickens at the mere thought of your base notes, where the sultry allure of amber and patchouli entwine in an intoxicating embrace, leaving an indelible imprint upon my soul.<br />
<br />
With each delicate spritz of your essence, I am transported to a realm where time stands still, where every moment is infused with the ineffable magic of our connection. You are not merely a fragrance, my dear William; you are a whispered promise of enchantment, a lingering caress that lingers upon my skin like a tender kiss.<br />
<br />
In your presence, I am bewitched, entranced by the sheer depth of your complexity, your imitable charm that sets my heart aflutter. So, let me linger in your embrace a while longer, my dearest William Penhaligon, for in your fragrance, I have found a love that transcends the boundaries of time and space.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="2133528"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=2133528#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1784586" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1784586" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MysticalArugula"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1703303.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MysticalArugula" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1784586ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1784586" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303">MysticalArugula</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-15">03/15/23 22:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just tested this fragrance from the portraits collection and it smells like second skin scent with some creamy incense. It's more masculine but I think I would wear it like on a day to day. Definitely would suggest this perfume for someone who is looking for a signature scent that is androgynous, natural, lactonic and slightly woody.<br />
<br />
 Fragrance Zodiac trio: VirgoGemini Capricorn</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1784586"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1784586#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1837209" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1837209" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hojubaby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178633"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1178633.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hojubaby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Antoine-Barrois/Tilia-91688.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91688.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tilia"title="Tilia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1837209ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1837209" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178633">Hojubaby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-19">05/19/23 14:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>All i can say is ay caramba in the best possible way, i want this and i want it as a signature scent.<br />
This smells like a citrusy and creamy vetiver, also very woody and perfectly blended scent. I think this is unisex leaning masculine but women can pull it off.<br />

</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1334909" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1334909" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1334909ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1334909" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-30">04/30/21 05:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Aspects of this are good. <br />
The opening conveys the pleasant citrus fruits, its got sharp citrus, ya limes, yer bergamots, but quite muted allowing for a nice translucent veil you can see the rest of the fragrance through, as it were. I get a slight facet of like grapes or pear or something, but immediately levied against dry GnT Sparkle, which continues the dehydrated theme into vetiver territory. Then it goes off the reservation for me, souring down on skin to a dry boring, papery, base which to me is predominantly Iso E Super or Timbersilk. Sure Ill give you that theres ambroxan and sandalwood molecules too if you insist but it mainly smells of arid, bready,  wood, with only shades of the top and heart left after a relatively short period.<br />
Ive kinda been tempted by Morillas own line because from memory and although in his style I found some of them to be just fantastic. However, this is always my worry that they wont deliver on the full perfume experience and leave me wanting, like this one does. <br />
Sorry Albert lad!<br />
I mean its okay, but its top loaded to make you think it might be good and justify buying, but Id be disappointed if I bought that fancy bottle and this was lurking in the drydown.<br />
<br />
UPDATE: okay so I was a little hasty and I found it odd that it went so dry, paper woody and boring, now the musks, woody amber, Ambroxan and stuff is chiming and it smells like a high end designer fragrance. Which is what it is. I actually had a shower and washed it off but the remnant is really nice, uninspired but nice and I cant deny I do like commercial accords like this, its a weakness of mine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1334909"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1334909#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1758583" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1758583" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="raw.beast"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516279"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1516279.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="raw.beast" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Franck-Boclet/Crime-49358.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49358.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Crime"title="Crime"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1758583ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1758583" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516279">raw.beast</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-12">02/12/23 16:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted to test some frags from this House, but most of em have the notes Im avoiding. So picked up this one. And got those notes even here, oh damn. <br />
It has strong vanilla shades with certainly lavender, yes. And I can smell some sweaty notes (its a mix of jasmine and sandalwood, I guess) as in most of Amouage frags. Bergamot and cedar are barely noticeable at all. <br />
Its soft, warm, a little bit musky and total unisex. <br />
I have to pass :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1758583"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1758583#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1337213" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1337213" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mohsen95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mohsen95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1337213ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1337213" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817">mohsen95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-04">05/04/21 07:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>3/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="1337213"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=1337213#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2159953" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2159953" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Amir.Fr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1653531"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1653531.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Amir.Fr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="XJ 1861 Naxos"title="XJ 1861 Naxos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2159953ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2159953" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1653531">Amir.Fr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-18">05/18/24 07:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>             <br />
        </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="63969"comment_id="2159953"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Inimitable-William-Penhaligon-63969.html?ccid=2159953#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="63969" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

        <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/news/en/21561/news.21561-60x64.jpg" style="width: 60px; height: 64px; margin-right: 0.5em; flex-shrink: 0"/>

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
